tweets.content:
I stand with the members of the SEIU Local 1 janitors union rallying today for better pay.
 
Every worker deserves $15 and a union. #FightFor15
https://t.co/GBzd2tw7C5

Thousands of low-wage contract workers missed a month of paychecks because of the Trump shutdown.

On the Senate floor, I asked my colleagues to join @SenTinaSmith’s amendment that would make sure those workers receive their back pay. https://t.co/u5ftcfbme5

The Trump administration and @CFPB should be standing up for consumers, not selling access to their payday lender pals. 

This is unacceptable. https://t.co/k8mDc3B8dF

Toni Morrison’s body of work changed America. She illustrated palpable narrations of the depth and meaning of the lived experiences of the oppressed. 

Morrison stood firm in the power of language, and her work continues to be a source of empowerment to this day.
Yesterday, @senrobportman and I introduced a resolution to honor the life, work, and legacy of Toni Morrison. https://t.co/01dbsHj72a

Today, thirty-two senators and I sent a letter to @SecretaryCarson demanding he retract his statements about the rights of transgender individuals.
 
If the Secretary is truly committed to recognizing the value of the people he serves, he must publicly retract his statements. https://t.co/PzUQQaYgfd

It’s despicable that President Trump would pull the rug out from under hungry Ohioans, especially children. 

If President Trump wants to save taxpayer money, he should roll back the tax bill that gave handouts to corporations at the expense of families. https://t.co/77tE554Wfp
My statement on @UAW vote to ratify contract with @GM: https://t.co/yJ0McxokK6

We need to support our communities with the tools and resources they need to empower moms and their families. Thank you for all the work you’re doing to reduce negative birth outcomes across Ohio. #HealthyStartReauthorization https://t.co/uawrdRTQit

It’s shameful the lengths that corporate front groups will go to, to encourage workers not to bargain for better pay, health care benefits, and job security — after Ohioans already said hell no to “right to work.” https://t.co/dfr6G2Yk9A

Addiction isn’t an individual problem or a character flaw, it’s a disease — one that often starts in the family medicine cabinet. That’s why tomorrow is so important. All prescription medications should be disposed of safely to prevent them from falling into the wrong hands.

Tomorrow, October 26th, is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day.
 
This day will provide Ohioans with a safe and convenient way to dispose of unwanted and unused prescription drugs. Look up the drug take-back site closest to you here: https://t.co/bUh4Z025VX

As we commemorate this anniversary, we honor the Polish forces who heroically fought back against Nazi German occupation. 

We also honor those who lost their lives, bravely fighting for humanity against insurmountable odds.
Today @senrobportman and I introduced legislation honoring the 75th Anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising. https://t.co/HNjTur6yvw

The climate crisis is one of the defining moral issues of our time, and it’s unconscionable that the Trump administration is burying research that shows its impact.
 
This investigation is long overdue. https://t.co/OCBqGLuXby

RT @RepJayapal: Proud to have @SenSherrodBrown and @SenWarren as partners on the #StudentsNotProfits Act.

The bill would protect students…

Proud to join my colleagues @SenatorBurr, @SenStabenow, and @SenJoniErnst in introducing legislation to reauthorize the Healthy Start program as we continue working to reduce the infant mortality rate in Ohio and across the country. https://t.co/qCfLWA4mWe
@SenWhitehouse @SenatorTomUdall @SenatorMenendez Way to ruffle some feathers, @SenWhitehouse.

It’s a free for owl over here @SenWhitehouse, @SenatorTomUdall, and @SenatorMenendez. Looks like our new friend swooped in to haunt the legislative graveyard just in time for Halloween. https://t.co/aPKKEPEYGT

Thousands of students have been left with nearly worthless degrees and credits, limited job prospects, and tens of thousands of dollars in loan debt because these companies defrauded them.
 
Taxpayers shouldn’t be footing the bill for these institutions.

Proud to join @SenWarren and @RepJayapal in introducing the Students Not Profits Act to protect students from the predatory practices of for-profit colleges by ending taxpayer subsidies to these schools. https://t.co/vvdxlv7wE8

Sometimes owl you need is a Barred Owl perched outside of your window to bring office neighbors together. Thanks, @SenatorShaheen, for opening up your office so that we could get a better view.🦉 https://t.co/bNNpyP3gqs

Congrats to Stan Boney on 40 years of broadcasting in the Mahoning Valley.
https://t.co/iHU2689rNm

To compare the impeachment proceedings against you to lynching is inexcusable and wrong.
 
And anyone who agrees with that comparison should be ashamed.

Mr. President, your use of “lynching” is an insult to the thousands of Black Americans who lost their lives to this horrific act of violence and disregards the real impact of racist violence in this country. https://t.co/JVeAHaKOoO
RT @FSCDems: #ICYMI: Chairwoman @RepMaxineWaters and @SenSherrodBrown Blast Regulators for Allowing More Risky Trading | https://t.co/VrI2y…
We must honor the lives of those who were slain and continue to offer support to their loved ones and the Dayton community as we work to end senseless gun violence.

There is no reason one man should have been able to kill nine people in Dayton and injure dozens more in less than a minute — and if it weren’t for the brave first responders from the Dayton Police Department, far more lives could have been lost.
Today @senrobportman and I introduced a resolution condemning the horrific attack in Dayton, on August 4th, 2019. https://t.co/XNsBbAwpcV

President Trump's and the GOP's tax scam did nothing for workers and families. If Congress makes a fix to the law that takes care of restaurant owners, we must take care of workers. 

We need to expand the EITC and CTC now. #WorkingFamilies https://t.co/xQywcXCYWL
Had a great discussion, thanks for having me. https://t.co/2LSs4yFirQ

It was an honor for our office to attend the deployment ceremony for the 238th Aviation Regiment at the MAPS Air Museum in Canton this week. We wish these soldiers well on their deployment and thank them for their sacrifice and service. https://t.co/lXycGByaED
Congratulations to @Astro_Christina and @Astro_Jessica for completing the first-ever #AllWomanSpacewalk. https://t.co/565Jx3lCuZ
Great meeting the Lady Butchers of Cleveland, Melissa and Penny, and touring Saucisson this morning. https://t.co/ffOBlr22Vy
Our hearts are with his wife, Dr. Maya Rockeymoore Cummings, and the entire Baltimore community.

Connie and I are saddened by the passing of Rep. Elijah Cummings. A lot of members of Congress live in their districts, but Elijah was really 𝘰𝘧 his district. He always governed through the eyes of the people of Baltimore, and he was a fierce champion for civil rights.

RT @ChrisCoons: People give up dollars today for the promise of a secure retirement, with good health care and a pension. 

Congress must d…

American workers spent their whole lives paying into pension plans on the promise of a secure retirement. 

Congress must do its job and pass a solution that keeps that promise. #APensionIsAPromise

RT @SenatorHassan: American workers put their hard-earned dollars in pension plans because #APensionIsAPromise.
 
I'm urging my colleagues…

HAPPENING NOW: Workers and retirees from across the country share their stories as they demand Congress to act to save the pensions they’ve earned. #APensionIsAPromise

https://t.co/TZUcGrEj1X
WATCH LIVE: Sherrod joins workers, retirees, and @SenateDems to demand action to save the pensions workers earned. #APensionIsAPromise https://t.co/G9cUl3RJUL
Get well soon, @HardballChris. https://t.co/H0xINI4plS

People give up dollars today for the promise of a secure retirement, with good health care and a pension.

I urge my colleagues in the Senate to act to pass a solution that honors work and keeps that promise. #APensionIsAPromise https://t.co/S6kE3je7f9

These workers want to do their jobs.
 
It’s been 30 days, @GM. It’s time to come to the table and agree to a contract that honors the Dignity of Work so that @UAW workers can get back to work. https://t.co/8I6P3Rvd67

.@facebook is too big and too powerful, and it’s unconscionable for financial companies to aid it in monopolizing our economic infrastructure.
 
I trust others will see the wisdom of avoiding this ill-conceived undertaking.
Large payment companies are wise to avoid legitimizing @facebook’s private, global currency. https://t.co/m05XU1bRtV

On National #ComingOutDay we celebrate the courage it takes for those in the LGBTQ community to live as their full selves and recommit to building a more just world where those who haven't come out can do so without fear. I see you and I'm fighting alongside you. https://t.co/X3DX4jE8ru

President Trump’s approach to foreign policy has betrayed our Kurdish allies while threatening the lives of innocent civilians. I join my colleagues in calling on the president to stand with our allies and demand President Erdogan end military action against the Kurds.
We will not stand for this.

The Trump administration is pushing a case before the courts that would lead our country back to a time when a person with cancer could be denied health coverage or face premiums so high they had to choose between treatments & paying for groceries. https://t.co/EVWWaLuCPS

Just another reminder that President Trump and the GOP’s tax scam was a handout to corporations at the expense of workers.
 
We need to pass the #WorkingFamilies Tax Relief Act and put money where it belongs: in the pockets of American workers.
https://t.co/pnKYXq416T
Another betrayal by President Trump — choosing corporations over American workers. Shameful. https://t.co/8y7vAXrevR
Wishing all those observing Yom Kippur an easy and meaningful fast. G’mar Chatimah Tovah.

President Trump’s chaotic approach to foreign policy doesn’t serve our national security interests and doesn’t make the world safer. 

I support a well-organized withdrawal from Syria, instead of one that bolsters autocrats and betrays our allies.

RT @SenDuckworth: I was honored to participate in the 5th #OhioWomensSummit with @SenSherrodBrown in Ohio today. 

We'll keep working to en…

Connie and I are honored to present our good friend, Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley, with the 2019 Canary Award for her resilience and strength in the fight to end gun violence. #DoSomething #OhioWomensSummit https://t.co/pej4kc4Jc9
Thank you for coming, @SenDuckworth. #OhioWomensSummit https://t.co/XHLiPnsmYe
Fireside chat: Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist, ⁦@ConnieSchultz⁩ interviewing ⁦@SenDuckworth⁩ on how she’s asserted her power throughout her career. #OhioWomensSummit https://t.co/pQtvJlFYQ9
Good morning, Cleveland. Connie and I are excited to be at our 5th Annual Women’s Leadership Summit: Asserting Your Power, with my friend @SenDuckworth. #OhioWomensSummit https://t.co/lAgGwrjfMY

Manufacturing is one of our state’s most important industries, and Ohio workers continue to drive the success of the industry across the state. 

On National Manufacturing Day, we celebrate the innovation and skill of manufacturing workers in Ohio and honor the Dignity of Work.

Antibiotics do a world of good fighting infections & illness, but now antibiotics are becoming less effective. Congress needs to act on the STAAR Act to stop the spread of deadly superbugs and to preserve antibiotics as a tool to fight disease. #ReachForTheSTAAR https://t.co/64Xy2WpvGO
This executive order isn’t pro-Medicare — it’s pro-insurance company. https://t.co/HWAb5fIsns

@PPSWO Double #OhioWomenWednesday ahead of the summit. Meet Kathleen Buse, Ph.D., with the Women’s Leadership Institute at ERC!
 
On Saturday, Ms. Buse will lead a workshop to equip participants with the tools you need to assert their power. You don’t want to miss it. https://t.co/7TV1x9cQz3

RT @RASbucks: MBK Statewide convening 2019.

Today we were able to listen to some of the notable speakers, have a table at the resource fai…
RT @msmithDC: Are you your brother’s keeper? OHIO IS! #wearembk @MBK_Ohio @MBK_Alliance https://t.co/UwMgVSQojF
Thanks for having me, @MBK_Ohio.

Future scientists, engineers, journalists, teachers, and entrepreneurs sit in classrooms all over Ohio and don’t get the resources they deserve. That’s what @MBK_Alliance is all about — connecting students with adults from all different career paths, who can help them succeed.
Honored to give the keynote address at the 2nd Annual My Brother’s Keeper (MBK) Ohio Statewide Conference in Columbus today. https://t.co/nsIq3A1Nt2

On today’s #OhioWomenWednesday — meet one of our many amazing panelists: Kersha Deibel, President & CEO of Planned Parenthood Southwest Ohio Region.
 
The Women’s Leadership Summit is this Saturday —don’t forget to register➡️ https://t.co/cP8E0A0UdS https://t.co/tsMW83IEbE
WATCH: @jaden_reports exclusive interview with Sherrod. https://t.co/eUPhXnbvWb
RT @jaden_reports: Photos from Ohio Senator Sherrod Brown’s visit to the picket lines at the GM powertrain in Toledo, Ohio. Senator Brown t…
RT @jaden_reports: WATCH: Ohio Senator Sherrod Brown meets with the local media about the GM strike. https://t.co/ZB0kHx7FAl
RT @jaden_reports: LIVE: Ohio Senator Sherrod Brown meets with striking workers https://t.co/jfcJT9RnNZ

It was an honor to talk with Ohio’s own, @jaden_reports, about the Dignity of Work. It’s inspiring to see that at the age of 11, he already understands the important role journalists play in our democracy, uncovering the truth. https://t.co/IismerA6Wt

Week 3: Proud to still be standing alongside @UAW as they fight for fair wages, better working conditions, & investment in their local communities.
 
We must keep the pressure on @GM to agree to a contract that honors the Dignity of Work. https://t.co/q2e3J86mG6

The President promised to fight for American workers — but today’s swearing-in of Eugene Scalia as Secretary of Labor is just the latest proof that President Trump has betrayed workers. https://t.co/T6em6h17e9
Shana Tova to all who are celebrating Rosh Hashanah. Wishing you a joyous and peaceful new year.

HBCUs and all MSIs have to overcome enough hurdles every day to educate their students — the United States Senate should not be one of them.

We need to pass the FUTURE Act now. https://t.co/G2Xtoh7IRz
Now @GM needs to agree to a contract that honors the Dignity of Work — and we’ll keep fighting until that happens.

.@GM only reversed course and decided to give striking workers their health insurance after public pressure forced the company to do the right thing. This is further proof that we must keep fighting and holding GM accountable for how it treats workers. https://t.co/gTS9aYqfRB
For the first time in my life, I rooted for the Yankees. And then they laid down for Tampa Bay. Is there no justice?
For 50 years, @NARAL has helped lead the fight for reproductive freedom for all. Their work is more important now than ever. #NARAL50

Another example of the Trump Administration proposing a self-initiated, flawed rule that will take food assistance away from millions of Americans, disproportionately affecting children, seniors, and working families. Shameful. https://t.co/jY522BGPUY

We need a Secretary of Labor who will actually fight for labor — not a corporate lawyer.
 
Eugene Scalia’s nomination is just President Trump’s latest betrayal of American workers. #SecretaryOfCorporateInterests https://t.co/BEO4TRxkxR
We know the President tried to get a foreign government to undermine American democracy. We have a responsibility to find out exactly what happened.
Hardworking people in Ohio don’t get to pick and choose which laws they get to follow and neither does the President — no one is above the law.
Our intelligence officials are the best in the world, and when one of them is so worried about our country that they risk their career and reputation, I take that very seriously.

Our staff had a great time at the Mahoning Valley Skilled Trades Expo today. Our factories, engineering facilities, & construction sites are innovative & high-tech, & they’ll employ thousands of Ohioans in the years ahead. I hope Ohioans will explore career options like these. https://t.co/HnpqGv66JZ

President Trump loves to say that he’s on the side of workers, but if he really cared about these workers, he wouldn’t have robbed thousands of Ohioans and millions of Americans of their overtime pay. https://t.co/a2Et1aiD9L

Eugene Scalia has spent his career helping corporations skirt the rules at workers’ expense. We can’t have a Secretary of Labor with a long record undermining workers and defending corporations who have trampled on their rights. #SecretaryOfCorporateInterests

Leading up to this year’s Ohio Women’s Leadership Summit, we’re back with #OhioWomenWednesday — first up, meet our host: Dee Perry.
 
If you haven’t registered for the conference yet, head over to https://t.co/cP8E0A0UdS now. https://t.co/HhQSkezqdB

Today, in front of the House Judiciary Committee, Mayor @nanwhaley called on leaders to #DoSomething on gun violence for the people of Dayton and every community torn apart by gun violence.

Thank you for your leadership in this fight, Mayor. https://t.co/C82ZU91x1u
RT @AFGENational: “If you love your country, you fight for the people who make it work.” - @SenSherrodBrown #FedUpRiseUp #1u https://t.co/E…
RT @AFLCIO: “You can’t say you love your country, then turn around and attack unions” - @SenSherrodBrown #FedUpRiseUp #1u https://t.co/cbX4…

People who work 50 or 60 hours a week should be paid the wages they’ve earned — period. The Trump administration is breaking its promise to hardworking Americans by failing to stand up for workers and expanding the overtime rule. https://t.co/gQvhKJDWH4

“Democrats will continue providing solutions to protect American jobs and secure the best possible deal for American workers.”
 
If you missed Rep. @rosadelauro’s and my letter to the @washingtonpost, you can read it below ⬇ https://t.co/0uHYW9veTo

All workers have the right to stand up for fair wages, better working conditions, and investment in their local communities.
 
Honored to walk the picket line with @UAW in Parma today. https://t.co/quZrnyM2Vh

.@GM has forgotten that it was taxpayers who saved their company. 

GM needs to agree to a contract that honors the Dignity of Work, and recognizes that it’s workers driving the auto industry’s success. https://t.co/4n9YYkbv2i
.@GM: @UAW deserves better. https://t.co/74qivct2iA

Renegotiating NAFTA is not about politics. It is about the livelihoods of American workers.
 
Read Rep. @rosadelauro’s and my letter to the editor on NAFTA here:  https://t.co/Q35fR7bSrH
Always great visiting Governor Taft and his students at @univofdayton. Thanks for having me. https://t.co/QpqJXv20Ej

I was a senior in high school when I organized a rally for the first Earth Day in Mansfield, Ohio.
 
It’s inspiring to see young people organizing here at home — and across the world — to demand their leaders to act on climate change. I stand with you. #ClimateStrike https://t.co/sqL1ismymb

Today we honor and remember the servicemembers who were prisoners of war and those who never returned home to their families — thank you for your sacrifice.
 
We are also thinking of the families who live with the pain of not knowing whether their loved one will return. https://t.co/jl9OH4oDo8

Thousands of @UAW workers in Ohio and around the country are going without their paychecks and health insurance to demand @GM respect the work they do to make their company successful.

Workers are fed up. https://t.co/UO1kf4UDRd
@SenDuckworth Register today at: https://t.co/cP8E0A0UdS.

CLEVELAND: @SenDuckworth has a special message for you!

Our fifth annual Ohio Women’s Leadership Summit will be in Cleveland on Saturday, October 5th. https://t.co/PYZi4SqdUi
.@GM: This is unacceptable — these workers deserve better.

Bryan Paulson’s 4-year-old daughter, Chesney, had a doctor’s appointment scheduled for next week for her hearing.

But because @GM canceled their worker’s health insurance without notice, her parents won’t know if the tubes in her ears are okay. https://t.co/gkHYO0CJNb
Do something, President Trump and Mitch McConnell. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/6bO8rjinst

RT @SenateDems: .@SenSherrodBrown: “We should hear that shout, to do something.”

HR8 has been stuck in @SenateMajLdr McConnell’s legislati…

HAPPENING NOW: Sherrod joins Senator @ChrisMurphyCT and Senate Democrats on the floor to keep up the pressure on Mitch McConnell and President Trump to take action on gun violence. #EndGunViolence

https://t.co/6bOJ5nomi1
TONIGHT: I’ll be playing #Hardball at 7:15 p.m. ET with @HardballChris talking about autoworkers and commonsense gun legistlation — tune in.
.@UAW workers stood by @GM when times were tough and their sacrifices helped save the company. All they are asking for is to earn their fair share now that times are good.

This is Randy from @UAW Local 14 in Toledo. His son has a doctors appointment today, but Randy doesn’t know if he can go because @GM cut off his insurance without warning — health insurance he worked hard to earn. 

These dirty tactics have to stop. https://t.co/6VI5BBoIuV

President Trump’s attacks on women’s health has real consequences. 

Two Planned Parenthood clinics in Cincinnati will be forced to close their doors — this will be devastating for so many Southwest Ohio women. #SaveTitleX https://t.co/OrctHBvexM

Let’s be clear: Autoworkers are the engine behind GM’s success.
 
GM needs to agree to a contract that honors the Dignity of Work and recognizes the autoworkers, communities, and families who all help drive the success of the auto industry in Ohio and across the country. https://t.co/qI5Vr6Re54

https://t.co/6WU0F8Su8V

I’m pleased to join Senator Portman in honoring Ohio-native Neil Armstrong by renaming NASA Glenn’s Plum Brook Station in Sandusky for a man who inspires future Ohioans to continue our state’s tradition of breaking barriers in space.
Yesterday, @senrobportman and I introduced legislation to rename NASA’s Plum Brook Station, the agency’s test facility in Sandusky, Ohio, after Neil Armstrong. https://t.co/vAZeiQ1OYy
RT @SenDougJones: Thanks, BUT my question was about why you and your agency are weakening civil rights protections—making it damn near impo…
No more tax bills that don’t put money in the pockets of workers and families. It’s time for Congress to act on the #WorkingFamilies Tax Relief Act. https://t.co/AKNYzy6DJy

Yesterday, Sherrod announced that the @USDA has made disaster relief funds available for Ohio farmers hit by natural disasters in 2018 and 2019. https://t.co/EGstEnNXpm

Always enjoy meeting with Ohio’s Community Health Centers. Thank you for all the work you do every day to keep Ohioans healthy. Know that I am with you and will continue to fight to get funding extended as quickly as possible. https://t.co/Duq7vYOIVJ

Today we remember those whose lives were taken 18 years ago, the first responders & ordinary citizens who dropped everything to help fellow Americans in need.

We also thank our brave servicemembers who responded to the call to serve our nation that day & every day since. https://t.co/loCYSSaEjL

.@NLRB’s decision to deny @Boeing South Carolina flight technicians from forming a union is simply wrong. I stand with the @MachinistsUnion in their ongoing fight to bring justice and collective bargaining rights to workers at the South Carolina facility.
These repeated attacks on women’s rights must stop. Congress needs to act and protect Title X.

Allowing politicians to make reckless decisions about women’s health care has consequences and today’s example is the closure of these two critical health centers in Cincinnati. https://t.co/jUwmHbzr13

Join me for a Facebook Live Townhall 9/16 at 5:45PM ET. President Trump’s tax scam left #WorkingFamilies out. We can’t allow him to do it again. No more tax bills unless they put money in the pockets of workers & families. Share your story. https://t.co/K52Ow5reDh

WATCH LIVE: Sherrod joins Dayton Mayor @nanwhaley, Senators Schumer and Stabenow, Speaker Pelosi, and Representatives Escobar and Thompson in calling on Mitch McConnell to bring the House-passed Bipartisan Background Checks Act to the Senate floor for a vote. https://t.co/xeOrngLsNJ

Thank you to Ohio veterans for sharing your stories with me in Geauga County today. Ohio veterans have sacrificed so much for our country and we need to ensure they get the quality education, job opportunities, and health care they've earned. https://t.co/4ddDDGeMLu

Happy National Read a Book Day. 📚 I just finished "The Tattooist of Auschwitz" by Heather Morris.

Reply below with what books you’re reading.

Thank you to all the workers, union members and leaders, and business owners from across the state who joined us.
 
You can learn more about the Right to Training Act of 2019 and our tour here:
https://t.co/KQMieKRCYl
Today we wrapped up our Right to Train tour in Toledo at UAW Local 12. https://t.co/UResx4Drtj
We were at the Youngstown Historical Center of Industry & Labor yesterday in Youngstown on stop number 5! https://t.co/B8xZhT3n6h
Meet the newest addition to our family, Walter. https://t.co/dU26OoKbwA

President Trump’s housing plan will make mortgages more expensive and harder to get. I’m urging the President: Make it easier for working people to buy or rent their homes, not harder.  https://t.co/6X6CcEa2PX
Yesterday’s stop on our Right to Train tour took us to Belmont College in St. Clairsville. https://t.co/DeHVQ8bEc4

This is a step in the right direction to help end gun violence. 

Now, it’s time for the President and Mitch McConnell to act.  
https://t.co/p757VRVHfK

Stop number three on our Right to Train tour took us to USW Local 169 in Mansfield yesterday. Productive conversation. No matter how technology changes, Ohio workers will always be our greatest resource. https://t.co/47L6dGUzTS

BREAKING: Sherrod announces $55.5M grant to address Ohio opioid crisis. The funds will be used to expand access to addiction treatment such as medication-assisted treatment (MAT). https://t.co/8528MNfrEy
I will fight back against any attempt by the President to rob Ohio’s servicemembers and key defense installations across our state of this funding so that he can score political points.
The President’s decision to go around Congress and take funding away from our military to support his vanity project is reckless and irresponsible. https://t.co/SoxOcrLTqR
I will never stop fighting to protect women’s freedom to make their own health care decisions. Thank you for letting me join the discussion. https://t.co/KxUXx7zkIa
🚨 Today is the LAST day to apply for federal disaster relief aid. Apply online at https://t.co/yI4wSDVj4x or call 1-800-621-3362 for more information. 🚨

Happy Labor Day to all American workers.
 
I want to particularly thank all of you who aren’t able to spend the day with families and friends because you don’t have the day off. You’re working hard to support your families, often for too little pay.
My statement on today’s events in Texas: https://t.co/3LGnkubZd6
Don’t forget — the deadline to apply for federal assistance is Tuesday, September 3rd. Ohioans can apply online at https://t.co/yI4wSEcUt7 or by calling 1-800-621-3362 for more information.
Here at UAW Local 1219 in Lima today on the second stop of our Right to Train tour. https://t.co/HeQvwNBL3y

25 days ago, I looked President Trump in the eye during his visit to Dayton and I implored the President to call McConnell and ask him to hold a vote.

The President still has not found the courage to stand up to the NRA. https://t.co/fbOCxHXxm8

The @vindicator publishes its last paper tomorrow after 150 years of serving the Mahoning Valley. It was an honor to work with its talented reporters & editors. It's important now more than ever that we stand up for a free press & stand with our local journalists. https://t.co/fbc2dtKg7z

It’s time for President Trump to stop sabotaging the country he’s supposed to lead.
 
Climate change is one of the defining moral issues of our time — and we need to preserve our country for our children and their children before it’s too late. https://t.co/gdAjJNr1rF

I’m proud to work with @senrobportman and @SenAngusKing on the Housing for Homeless Students Act. Students and veterans who have experienced homelessness shouldn’t be forced to choose between pursuing an education and access to affordable housing. https://t.co/B8DCT7MhmG
